description: Redevelopment of an existing site to accommodate ten residential units (self-contained flats) over basement, ground, first and second floors and installation of two rooflights to side roofslope; two rooflights to front roofslope with associated communal amenity space, car parking, refuse and cycle storage (following demolition of the existing building).
decision_conditions: 1.	The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| Approved Plans

2.	The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 16001-P02, 16001-P03, 16001-P04, 16001-P05, 16001-P06, 16001-P07, 16001-P08, 16001-P09, 16001-P10.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| Materials

3.	Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, details of the materials to be used for the external surfaces shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development hereby approved is commenced. The details shall be fully implemented as approved.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4 and 7B, policies 1.1 (h), 1.2 (g) and 2.10 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015).
| Landscape Works

4.	Details of landscape works and boundary treatment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, prior to first occupation. These works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development.

Reason: To protect the visual character and appearance for neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 7A, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 2.10, and policies 7.1, 7.2, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015).
| Construction of new car parking spaces

5.	The car parking spaces shown on the approved plan 16001-P02 shall be formed prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan 2015 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan.
| Cycle Parking
6.	Provision for cycle storage in accordance with adopted standards shall be provided prior to occupation and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate bicycle storage provision and in the interests of reducing congestion to the local transport network, in accordance with policies 1.1 (j) and 3.1(i) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.9, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Refuse Storage and Management

7.	Refuse and recycling storage as indicated on the approved plans and in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority, shall be provided. Such provision shall be implemented and made available prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and retained in perpetuity.

Reason:  To ensure that suitable and accessible refuse storage facilities are provided and in the interests of the visual and general amenities of the area, in accordance with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016 as amended).
| Sustainable Design and Construction

8.	Prior to the first occupation of the dwellings, the approved domestic units shall incorporate and maintain sustainability measures in line with the Energy and Sustainability Statement (7th April 2017) Issue 01 prepared by Mecserve.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2015, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012.
| Ultra-Low NOx Gas boilers dry NOx emission below 40 mg/kWh

9.	Prior to the first occupation of the dwellings, the approved domestic units shall incorporate and maintain Ultra low-NOx boilers gas boilers for the provision of the space heating and hot water requirements with dry NOx Emissions below 40 mg/kWh.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 of the London Plan 2015, policies LV5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG, April 2014.
| Overheating and Cooling

10.	Prior to commencement of the development, the details of the dynamic thermal modelling for each apartment using the guidance provided in CIBSE TM49 & TM52 shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval demonstrating that the development performs against their overheating criteria and exceed the requirements to avoid overheating. The details of any additional measures to be incorporated into the development to minimise the risk of overheating (without active cooling) shall also be submitted if the dynamic thermal modelling demonstrates that overheating would occur. The development shall thereafter be provided in accordance with the approved details.
Reason: To ensure that the risk of overheating has been sufficiently addressed in accordance with policy 5.9 of the London Plan (2016).
| Water Efficiency for dwellings

11.	Prior to commencement of the development proposing the construction of residential units, a water efficiency statement shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority demonstrating all measures that will be incorporated to ensure that the residential units will meet water efficiency standards with a maximum water use target of 105 litres of water per person per day. Development shall proceed in accordance with the approved water efficiency statement.
Reason: To ensure the sustainable use of water, in accordance with policy 5.15 of the London Plan 2016.
| Energy Strategy Condition

12.	5A) Within three-months of the first occupation of each dwelling in the approved development, Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's] and detailed modelling output reports showing clearly the DER and TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures should be also submitted for written approval by the Local Authority.

5B) Within three-months of the practical completion of the dwellings evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.

5C) Prior to the final completion of all dwellings of the development, the approved dwellings shall incorporate measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 35.6% (equal to 5.5 tonnes CO2/year) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy and Sustainability Statement (7th April 2017) Issue 01 prepared by Mecserve:

i.	energy saving measures to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 1.6 tonnes CO2 equating to 10.7% CO2 emissions reduction in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 baseline

ii.	incorporation of solar PV technology with a total capacity of 9.72kWp to supply at least 7.4 MWh of electricity annually and achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 3.83 tonnes CO2 equating to 28% in carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions reduction over the Be Lean stage of the Energy Hierarchy.

5D) Measures to reduce the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be incorporated and maintained in line with approved Energy and Sustainability Statement (7th April 2017) Issue 01 prepared by Mecserve.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason:  To ensure that the dwellings within the development hereby approved are energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
| Renewable/Low Carbon (&CO2) Energy Monitoring

13.	Upon final completion of the development and prior to occupation, suitable devices for monitoring either the renewable/low-carbon energy technology(ies), including solar PV, incorporated into the development and/or heat and electricity imported into the site shall be installed. The monitored data shall be submitted to the local planning authority at daily intervals for a period of three years from final completion. The installation of the monitoring devices should be in a compatible format and the submission of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in Automated Energy (& CO2) Monitoring Platform [AEMP] document.

Reason:  To monitor the effectiveness of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 5.7 of the London Plan 2015, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Development Management DPD (December 2013).
| 14.	The installation in each dwelling of an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of under 40 mg/kWh shall be completed prior to first occupation and thereafter permanently retained.
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| 15.	The development herby approved must be provided with filtered fresh air ventilation system capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides in the external air. The ventilation system shall be completed prior to first occupation and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with SPG10: Noise & Vibration, policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016) and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Noise Insulation

16.	Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the Local Planning Authority:
a.	Bedrooms (23.00-07.00 hrs) 30 dB LAeq and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
b.	Living rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 35 dB LAeq.
c.	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first to first occupation and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.
| Construction Management Plan

17.	A detailed construction method statement relating to the redevelopment of existing building to accommodate ten residential units (self-contained flats) over basement, ground, first and second floors shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the use on-site.  The statement shall include the following details:
a.	Removal of any earth from the site.
b.	Site clearance, demolition, excavation and construction methods.
c.	Site management and access.
d.	Signage for construction traffic, pedestrians and other users of the site.
e.	Prevention of mud and debris being deposited on Carlton Road, Castlebar Road (B455) and nearby streets.
f.	Vehicle and machinery specification.
g.	Turning manoeuvres and routeing of vehicles.
h.	Estimated number and frequency of vehicle deliveries.
i.	Parking of construction vehicles.
j.	Compliance with noise limits and vibration mitigation measures.
k.	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.
l.	Mitigation of air pollution and dust emissions during site clearance, demolition, excavation and construction works.
m.	Waste management, hazardous material storage and removal.
n.	Details of construction hours;

o.	A restriction that the footpath and carriageway on Carlton Road is not blocked during construction. No encroachment on the clear space needed to maintain the safe and uninterrupted flow of road users and pedestrians;
p.	Noise mitigation and monitoring measures;
q.	Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials;
r.	Site security during construction;

Reason:  In the interest of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013).
| Contamination
18.	The developer shall draw to the attention of the Local Planning Authority the presence of any unsuspected contamination encountered during the development.

a.	In the event of contamination to land and/or water being encountered, no development shall continue until a programme of investigation and/or remedial work to include methods of monitoring and certification of such work undertaken has been submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

None of the development shall be occupied until the approved remedial works, monitoring and certification of the works have been carried out and a full validation report has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
OR

b.	In the event that no contamination is encountered, the developer shall provide a written statement to the Local Planning Authority confirming that this was the case, and only after written approval by the Local Planning Authority shall the development be occupied.

Reason: To ensure that any ground and water contamination is identified and adequately addressed to ensure the safety of the development, the environment and to ensure the site is suitable for the proposed use.
